0.user_question: A boy has 1648176 cards. His brother has 3 fewer cards than he has. How many cards do they have together?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. We know that boys has 1648176 cards. Let’s calculate what happens if we subtract three (he’s brother) :  1648176 – 3 = 1648173 This result represent amount of card which brothers having . To get combined quantity let us sum it up using this formula above numbers :     Total_card= Boy_cards+Brothers_cars    Substitute those values into the formula above :      Total_card= 1648176 + 1648173       Finally , add these results :     Total_card= 3296349 Therefore, their siblings collectively own 3296349 cards. The answer is: 3296349.

0.user_question: A boy has 1648176 cards. His brother has 3 fewer cards than he has. How many cards do they have together?

1.subquestion: How many cards does the boy’s brother have?

subanswer.text:
Let's think step by step. First calculate what happens when you subtract three (the difference) form sixteen million four hundred seventy-six one minus seven (as opposed to eight). You get fifteen million forty-four thousand seven hundred twenty four or simply put, eighteen lakh thirty four thousand seven hundred twenty four [Indian Numbering System]. That means it would translate as follow into English; One Hundred Eighteen Lakh Thirty Four Thousand Seven Hundred Twenty Four Cards..In Indian system we say/read numbers till lakhs i.e., up to ten Lakhs so reading above sentence makes sense! Here “Laksh” literally translates as wealth which also denotes abundance etc… Therefore if I asked again whether my elder son who own such riches can share them equally among all villagers living around our house without any monetary compensation ,your reply might sound something like below :-
"He won’t let go!" But remember every child needs their fair & equal share too :) .

ost_step.1: To find out how many cards they have altogether now add back those three extra ones that his brother didn't receive initially -> Total = Boy's initial count – Brother deficit amount => Sum=Total_cards+deficit=>Sum=(Both)_Cards(Card Count)=sum((Boy'_Count),(-Brother'_Deficit))

direct_answer.text: To solve this problem we first calculate the broth's card counts which can be found using Booard Card Quantity-(Four) . Which translates into (Girl_card_count)-3=.So let us plug our values herein:(1648176)-3=1648173 And since adding these boys & brothers totals up too ,to get their joint sum all you need todo is just take both quantities n pluck them apartnadd emghtogether.(1648176)+(1648173)=3296349 Hence,(They BOTH HAVE)(Together CARD COUNT)=SUM=BOY_COUNT+(BROTHER_DEFICIT )

0.user_question: A boy has 1648176 cards. His brother has 3 fewer cards than he has. How many cards do they have together?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. First we need to find out how many cards the brother has which would be 1648176 – 3 cards. Which equals 1648173. We know already the first person has 1648176 cards so all combined it’d be like this :  1648176+1648173=3296349 .
